jobDescription:
À propos de KOHO

L'objectif de KOHO est de permettre aux Canadiens de bâtir d'excellentes fondations financières au moyen de produits qui sont radicalement transparents et faciles à gérer. Notre parcours a débuté en 2014 et nous avons depuis créé une communauté de plus de 800 000 utilisateurs. Des investisseurs de premier plan du monde entier croient en notre vision et nous avons réussi à amasser plus de 320 M$ pour la concrétiser. Le collectif KOHO compte maintenant plus de 300 employés. Découvrez notre culture ici et apprenez-en plus sur notre équipe ici !

À propos du poste

KOHO est à la recherche d'analystes de données (de niveau intermédiaire et avancé) pour stimuler la croissance de l'entreprise au cours du trimestre et à long terme en appuyant la prise de décision sur les données et en identifiant les occasions d'accroître les résultats d’affaires à l’échelle de l’entreprise. Ce poste est fait pour vous si vous aimez automatiser les rapports, élaborer des tableaux de bord et analyser les données pour en tirer des renseignements exploitables. Vous passerez une grande partie de votre temps à écrire des requêtes SQL, à développer des scripts Python et à consulter les membres de l'équipe chargée de l'exploitation.

Ce que vous ferez
Vous étudierez les sources de données actuelles pour élaborer des rapports précis.Vous élaborerez et présenterez des tableaux de bord mettant en évidence les résultats et les tendances.Vous effectuerez des analyses approfondies sur des questions d'affaires dans votre domaine de compétence.Vous évaluerez et prioriserez les demandes de données entrantes dans votre flux de travail. Vous collaborerez avec d’autres membres de l’équipe des données sur des projets d’équipe et préserverez notre entrepôt de données en tant que source de vérité de KOHO.Vous collaborerez à l’échelle de l’entreprise en agissant à titre de conseiller de confiance pour les parties prenantes.

Qui vous êtes
Vous avez au moins deux années d’expérience dans un poste d’analyste de données (l’ancienneté dépend de l’expérience).Vous manipulez aisément des ensembles de données à l’aide de SQL (vous connaissez bien les connexions automatiques, les fonctions de fenêtre et les paramètres) et vous possédez des connaissances intermédiaires en Python (fonctions définies par l’utilisateur, création de requêtes d'API, rédaction de boucles efficaces).Vous possédez de solides compétences quantitatives et analytiques ainsi qu'en matière de collecte de données.Vous étudiez rapidement les concepts d'affaires, les mesures et les indicateurs clés de performance.Vous avez un sentiment d’appartenance et la capacité de mener plusieurs tâches de front et d'en établir les priorités.Vous êtes bien organisé et vous savez gérer votre temps.

Points bonis si vous avez de l'expérience ou de l'intérêt dans ce qui suit!
GitExpérience dans le domaine financier

Qu'est-ce Que Vous y Gagnerez?

Nous investissons du temps et des ressources pour nous assurer que KOHO est aussi efficace que les personnes que nous embauchons. Voici quelques-unes des raisons pour lesquelles nous attirons et conservons les meilleures personnes :
 Vie équilibrée: journées de bien-être estivales à l’échelle de l’entreprise, fermeture en hiver pendant les vacances du temps des Fêtes, nombre illimité de jours de congé pour des raisons personnelles, compte de dépenses pour le bien-être ainsi que congé de maternité et parental bonifié. Travail à distance: travaillez de n’importe où au Canada et disposez d’un budget pour installer votre bureau à domicile. Niveau supérieur: bénéficiez des conseils de trois coachs internes certifiés et d'un budget de formation annuel. Atteinte des objectifs: évaluations salariales deux fois par année. Culture de KOHO: nous avons remporté sept prix « Meilleurs lieux de travail » depuis 2019. Soyez propriétaire : chaque employé de KOHO reçoit un montant généreux d’actions avec une période d’exercice de 10 ans.

La culture de KOHO est une culture de collaboration, de créativité et de perspectives diverses. Nous sommes déterminés à créer et à favoriser un environnement inclusif et accessible pour tous. Si vous avez des questions, des préoccupations ou des demandes relatives aux besoins d'accessibilité, veuillez communiquer avec peopleaccessibility@koho.ca et l’équipe de Talent et culture se fera un plaisir de vous aider.

Prenez note qu'un niveau avancé d'anglais, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral, est requis pour ce poste, car votre supérieur immédiat sera un anglophone. De plus, le processus d'embauche se déroulera en anglais et nous vous fournirons du soutien en français, s'il y a lieu.

La forme masculine utilisée dans ce document désigne aussi bien les femmes que les hommes. Le genre masculin est utilisé sans aucune discrimination et dans le seul but d’alléger le texte.
companyDescription:
We want Canadians to be able to travel more, retire sooner, and live more balanced lives. With an app and a reloadable card, KOHO is a totally new approach to spending and saving. Hundreds of thousands of Canadians are already using KOHO to spend smarter, save quicker, and restore financial balance.

We have the best user support in Canada, maybe the world, and a growing team of hungry fintech enthusiasts ready to change the way Canadians spend and save, for good. We've raised 4 rounds of funding, won the NASDAQ award for Best FinTech Co, and we're hiring.

jobDescription:
Are you passionate about stats and data and looking for a new challenge? McLean & Company, a division of Info-Tech Research Group, is looking for a Statistical Analyst to help us continue to grow our membership and help HR leaders and their teams succeed through data-informed decision making. You’ll be joining a fun, hard-working, collaborative team of professionals who enjoy the work they do.
McLean is a place where your voice will be heard – a place where you see the impact of your work on our 30,000+ members. It is a place where you will find community and collaboration, where you will work with diverse individuals with their own unique stories and experiences. McLean is a place where success is celebrated by the whole team – a place where you are encouraged to stretch and grow.

Key Responsibilities:Create custom reports based on survey results using a combination of R, R Markdown, Excel, and PowerPoint. Involves cleaning data, updating scripts used to generate report data to reflect survey customizations, creating custom report templates, formatting the final report for a polished, client-ready look.Conduct analyses on survey data for the Diagnostics and broader HR Research teams by extracting and merging data from our full suite of diagnostics, including Engagement, New Hire, and Exit. Analysis is conducted using R or Excel depending on the amount of data.Provide additional layer of quality assurance and troubleshoot problems that arise.Continuously work to improve reporting, providing recommendations for better ways to display data and/or new calculations to ensure validity and reliability.Learn and work with McLean & Company’s proprietary survey platforms.Provide support to the Director of Analytics with ongoing projects.Other duties as required as the team and product offerings continue to grow.

Required Education & Experience: Undergraduate degree in Math, Computer Science, Statistics or comparable required. Master’s degree an asset, but not required.Proficiency with RProficiency with the Microsoft Office suite specifically Excel and PowerPoint.Experience and comfortable in a customer service environment.
Desirable Experience: Proficiency with Python, SQL, R MarkdownProficiency with Power BI, Tableau, or similarProficiency with text analytics methodsExperience with employee lifecycle surveysExperience or exposure to HR, HR Analytics
SkillsData Analysis. Good data visualization and storytelling skills. Ability to communicate complex concepts for business use.Customer Service. Must be comfortable working directly with clients over phone/video meetings to scope requirements and work to find solutions.Problem-Solving Skills. Able to troubleshoot technical and data issues to identify root cause and propose a solution. Able to debug scripts efficiently.Organization and Attention to Detail. Must be extremely organized with a track record of meeting deadlines, delivering on commitments, and high level of accuracy.Teamwork and Collaboration. Work with other members of the Diagnostics team to balance workloads and share ideas/learning experiences. Maintain positive relationships within team and other departments.Change Management. Adapt to process changes and improvements on an ongoing basis.Willingness to Learn. Comfortable learning and working with various technologies and programming languages. Desire to learn, understand new things and how they work.

jobDescription:
Are you looking for your next challenge? Do you have a Process/Chemical Engineering Degree or equivalent with 4+ years of qualifying experience? If so, Apply now for this Remote APM Process Analytics Specialist job in Calgary, AB.

Adecco is currently recruiting for a full-time Remote APM Process Analytics Specialist in Calgary, AB, to work a long-term contract at a well-established energy company majoring in the production of synthetic crude from oil sands. In this diverse role, you will be working within an integrated team of subject matter experts to implement predictive analytics across an Oil & Gas Enterprise.
Pay Rate: $60 - $90 / hour, depending on experienceLocation: Work From HomeShifts: Monday - FridayJob type: Full-time |Long-Term Contract
Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop, Test and Validate Modelling and Analytics for Process Static Equipment including:Heat ExchangersFired HeatersBoilersDevelop models and Predictive Diagnostics in Analytical Platforms including but not limited to:AVEVA Process Optimization (ROMeo) - Equipment Performance KPIsAVEVA Predictive Analytics (PRiSM) - Machine Learning ModelsOSI PI Asset Framework - Data Mapping, Dashboarding, Eng. CalcsConduct scoping exercises, including large asset list review, business case development, and data gap assessmentMap control system tag data to analytic inputs/metrics by reviewing P&IDs and Historian DatabasesCollect and review engineering documentation for equipment specifications and system informationProvide Innovative ideas to support asset performance management initiativesProvide updates to APM program team, with support to schedule, scope and budget managementCoordinate, direct and review the work of vendors and engineering contractorsIdentify risks and issues within your area of responsibilityCreate supporting documentation or collecting information pertinent to the projectInterface with integrated team to work collaboratively
Requirements and Qualifications:
Process/Chemical Engineering Degree or equivalent with 4+ years of qualifying experience is neededExperience in Process System Modelling (Heat/Energy balance) in any tool such as ROMeo, Hysys, PRO/II, etc. is a mustKnowledge of reliability principles and asset management within Oil & Gas and/or Process IndustriesKnowledge of Heat Transfer Equipment Fundamentals and Key failure modesExperience reading/understanding P&IDs and engineering documentationInnovative Thinking with the use of data to provide asset insights with a strong interest in analyticsStrong written and verbal communication skills in English; ability to work effectively with personnel at site while based in CalgaryHigh proficiency with MS Office suite of products; Word, Excel, PowerPoint, ProjectQuick to learn and adapt to new tools/processesMust be legally eligible to work and reside in Canada
Don't miss out on this Remote APM Process Analytics Specialist job in Calgary, AB. This is your chance to get your foot in the door with a well-established energy company. Apply now and you will hear back from an Adecco Recruiter soon.

jobDescription:
What We do:
Kognitiv enables leading organizations to form collaborative commerce networks, unearth value for their consumers, and markedly improve returns.
Founded in 2008, Kognitiv enables collaborative commerce through its proprietary technology platform and performance model for leading global brands to build their own peer-to-peer trading networks. In June 2020, Kognitiv and Aimia’s Loyalty Solutions companies came together to create a technology-forward business, employing approximately 500 people across 20 countries worldwide.
With 200+ clients and partners in more than 50 markets globally, Kognitiv brings to life a world where brands work together to create new opportunities for less, gain direct access to new audiences, and create network effects where everyone wins, all the time.
We always welcome international candidates to apply providing they are eligible to work and live in Canada or US. This position is offered in, and may be performed only from, the following states in the US: Arizona, Connecticut, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, New Jersey, Nevada, Ohio, Ontario, Pennsylvania, Texas, and Wisconsin.
About the opportunity:
We are excited to be looking for a Consulting Analyst, Marketing and Loyalty Programs, to join our high performing Strategy and Consulting team! 
Reporting to the Director, Strategy & Consulting, this role will support the design and development of world-class loyalty programs as part of a dedicated team of Strategy and Consulting professionals.
This is growth role - you’ll have many opportunities to learn about a wide range of industries.You will be responsible for turning your persuasive insights from analyses into strategy recommendations for clients. You’ll use your excellent strategic, conceptual, and analytical skills in the client-facing work you do. This will include economic model development and content creation for proposals and client deliverables. 
The Strategy and Consulting group is a winning team, with a track record of success in securing engagements and delivering above our clients’ high expectations. We do not do any internal consulting.
Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):Structuring and executing analyses including client interviews, data analysis, and researchContributing to or leading economic model development that aligns with our strategy recommendations, including research to source assumptionsExtracting rich and persuasive insights from analysis, leading to well-supported and impactful recommendationsCreate deliverables and support their presentation to clientsIdentify ways for the client to gain further value from Kognitiv’s platforms and servicesContributing to the quality of the work of the team and be comfortable questioning resultsEfficiently and effectively execute against workplans; collaborating as needed with internal and external resources
Who are you?
We are looking for a candidate who (ideally) has previous analyst experience, who thrives in a fast paced, global company and is ready to hit the ground running! Skills that will help you be successful include problem-structuring, ad-hoc data analysis and experience working directly with clients.Communication is key and your ability to convey your message, through writing and verbally, should be top notch!
Our ideal candidate has…1-4 years relevant experience in a consulting, research, economics, or customer data and insights role. Experience with loyalty programs and marketing is a plus.Clear evidence of excellent strategic, conceptual, and analytic skillsStrong capability in the interpretation and presentation of analytics results and their implications for loyalty program designExperience in the development of financial and economic modelsConfidence in supporting or leading facilitated client workshopsExplicit and demonstrated passion for customer insights and their translation into executionDemonstrated ability to build strong, trust-based relationships across internal and external organizationsDemonstrated ability to deliver project workstreams on tight deadlines with high autonomy and light-touch oversight
We are a passionate, innovative organization with just over 500 team members globally and we are looking for exceptional people to come and join us. This is an exciting opportunity to work for an international business, in a high energy environment with a collaborative, smart and passionate team. If you like the sound of us and the role: get in touch!
Here at Kognitiv, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it! Greater diversity means greater variation in ways of thinking, perspectives and approach. And we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees and our clients. Kognitiv are committed to creating an inclusive environment and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, fit and business need.
companyDescription:
Kognitiv redefines loyalty by helping brands securely and efficiently activate their data to engage new audiences and existing customers to earn their lifetime loyalty. In June 2020, Kognitiv and Aimia’s Loyalty Solutions came together to create a technology-forward business, employing over 500 people across 20 countries worldwide. With 200+ clients and partners in more than 50 markets globally, Kognitiv brings to life a world where brands work together to create new opportunities for less, gain direct access to new audiences, and create network effects where everyone wins, all the time.

Kognitiv is headquartered in Kitchener, Canada, with team members in Canada (Waterloo, Mississauga, and Kitchener), Argentina (La Plata), Australia (Melbourne and Sydney), Austria (Vienna), Hong Kong, India (Bengaluru and Pune), Japan (Tokyo), Malaysia (Kuala Lumpur), Singapore, UK (London, Manchester, and Bournemouth) and United States (Charlottesville, Minneapolis and Newark).

jobDescription:
Req ID: 100460  Department: Corporate Risk  Job Type: Full-Time  Position Type: Non-Union  Location: Calgary, Alberta  Country: Canada  % of Travel: 0-10%  # of Positions: 1  Job Available to: Internal & External 
Canadian Pacific is a transcontinental railway in Canada and the United States with direct links to major ports on the west and east coasts, providing North American customers a competitive rail service with access to key markets in every corner of the globe. CP is growing with its customers, offering a suite of freight transportation services, logistics solutions and supply chain expertise. Visit cpr.ca to see the rail advantages of CP.
 PURPOSE OF THE POSITION: 
As the Data Analyst – Crime Analytics you will be responsible for the preparation and dissemination of a variety of products related to locations of criminal activity, which support operations undertaken by the Canadian Pacific Police Service (CPPS). You are responsible for the management of crime related statistics, and reporting, trend analysis, and quality assurance tasks associated with this operational requirement. You will primarily work independently and deliver quantitative analysis to CPPS leadership on a regular basis.
 POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES: 
 Knowledge of research methods, with a strong focus on quantitative analytical skills and data visualization and reporting techniques;  Assume the role of a subject matter expert as it relates to the identification of key trends associated with crime statistics tied to incidents which occur across a railway network spanning multiple Canadian provinces and U.S. states;  Maintain Power BI reports which provide front line members with up-to-date statistics relating to criminal incidents in the territories in which they operate;  Maintain and regularly review a database of criminal incidents, records, and documents;  Establish working relationships with front line members and operational Inspectors within CPPS, and effectively liaise with members of partner law enforcement agencies;  Support the broader remit of the Criminal Intelligence Unit as it relates to maintaining oversight of key threats to the broader organization’s personnel and operations;  Responsible for responding to critical incidents outside standard work hours when required. 
 POSITION REQUIREMENTS:   Post-secondary education, with a degree in Statistics, mathematics, business, criminology, or related fields would be considered an asset;  Experience in a policing or government environment with duties related to data analysis, reporting, and research would be considered an asset;  Ability to conduct quantitative analysis on large data-sets, to identify key trends, and to deliver meaningful analysis and recommendations based on this analysis;  Ability to present key findings from large datasets through a variety of methods, including heat mapping, Power BI reports, and a range of graphs and related visualization techniques;  Ability to troubleshoot databases, identify data reporting issues, and work with a range of stakeholders to address any issues;  Experience with the Microsoft Office suite of products (in particular MS Excel and Power BI), alongside Arc GIS mapping, police information systems including CPIC, and conducting internet-based research;  Ability to clean datasets, identify linkages and trends, and to present findings in a succinct manner;  Ability to multi-task, to work independently and in a small team environment, and to respond to regular requests from CPPS leadership;  Ability to work with and review confidential and sensitive materials while maintaining discretion;  Experience with the following would be considered beneficial: Hexagon CAD/RMS  Association/network charts  Timeline/sequence of events  Comparative case charts  Geo-mapping  Flow charts  Use computer databases, electronic spreadsheets, desktop publishing, word processing, and statistical applications to manipulate, analyze, and present data 
 WHAT CP HAS TO OFFER: 
 Flexible and competitive benefits package  Competitive company pension plan  Employee Share Purchase Plan  Performance Incentive Program  Annual Fitness Subsidy  Flexible work environment 
 ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: 
As an employer with national presence, the possibility does exist that the location of your position may be changed based on organizational requirements.
 Background Investigation: 
The successful candidate will need to successfully complete the following clearances:
 Ability to obtain a federal government secret level security clearance  Criminal history check  Reference check  Education Verification  Financial and credit check 
 Management Conductor Program: 
Becoming a qualified conductor or locomotive engineer is the single best way for a management employee to learn the business at CP. You may be required to obtain a certification or to maintain your current certification/qualification as a conductor or locomotive engineer.
CP is an equal opportunity employer committed to the principles of employment equity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals. All applicant information will be managed in accordance with the federal Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act ("PIPEDA").

jobDescription:
At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up - as individuals and as a team - to accomplish our strategy.

Business Intelligence Analyst

At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.

CWB is on a mission to become the best full-service bank for business owners of Canada.

We are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to fulfill the development, enhancements and support for all data warehouse, data marts, reporting, data visualizations and dashboards for the Canadian Western Bank Financial Group. This includes the documentation of all requirements and development details aligned to audit expectations.

As part of the Information Management team and in partnership with the business, you will utilize data from source systems to populate data assets and build attractive, intuitive and insightful information products.

If you are passionate about data analysis and find excitement in using your findings to drive business decisions, we want to hear from you!

What you will be responsible for
Assist business stakeholders in realizing their stated objectives through the use of data assets and information products that enable better and faster decisions and ensure completed solutions meet their specified requirements.Effectively communicate and build rapport with team members and business partners.Develop complex, mission critical reports, projects and applications.Deliver professional quality of data analysis and ETL processes to reduce the high consequence of error.Gather and formally document the object inventory, capturing details including data sources and data requirements to fulfill internal and external audit requirements.Build Extract, Transform, Load processes using SAS Data Integrator based on a logical model or design.Perform peer code reviews to ensure consistency to design, development and maintenance standards.Contribute to design and development standard methodologies and guidelines.Monitor and remediate all issues with the data warehouse/data marts and reports.Provide knowledge transfer to the other members of the development team.Perform and support daily tasks such as job scheduling, monitoring, troubleshooting and remediation.Support testing of solutions in all applicable environments.Support partners in the use of information products.Assist with training materials, and demonstrations.Ensure issues are identified, tracked, reported on and resolved in a timely manner.Participate in post-project implementation reviews or ‘lessons learned’, incorporating these lessons into appropriate process documentation, standards templates and checklists.Perform other duties as assigned by the Information Management leaders.
What You Will Bring To This Role
College diploma or university degree in Computer Science or related technology field.Experience in database and/or reporting environments incorporating Microsoft SQL Server technology.Strong query/data manipulation skills, especially utilizing Structured Query Language (SQL).Experience in data warehouse or data mart design and development.Experience with ETL processes/tools, SAS Data Integration studio considered a benefit.Working knowledge of TFS or equivalent project management, development management tools.Education in Advanced Mathematics and/or Statistics is an assetEducation or experience in Machine Learning and/or Artificial Intelligence is considered an assetExcellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills.Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.Ability to work with moderate supervision.Experience working on complex assignments requiring continuous periods of concentration, with periodic interruption.Strong organizational and analytical skills.Good interpersonal and communication (written & verbal) skills, including Technical writing ability.
Ignite your career. Apply with CWB today.

Why work with us?

Winners of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020 

& recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada by Great Places to Work

Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference. Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Flexible work arrangements. Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Compressed work weeks & more!

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities. Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work. Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Enhance. At CWB we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection. Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services. Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards. Yup! We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives.

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Targeted Diversity Language

Bring you. All of you. Feminist. First Nations band member. Gay rights activist. Sign language speaker. Labels don’t matter here, but your perspective does.

All applicants are welcome, and we expressly encourage applicants to apply who identify as women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities (including physical, mental, sensory, learning impairment, etc.), Indigenous peoples (including First Nations, Metis and Inuit), LGBTQ2S+ and/or racialized persons. We are specifically seeking diversity in this role, because at CWB we believe that inclusion has power, and we’re looking for some unique perspectives to add to this area of our business. We have a culture that thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration, respect, caring and camaraderie. If you have a voice to add to the conversation, we’d love you to apply.

As an equitable employer, CWB Financial Group is committed to providing a safe and inclusive environment where a diverse workforce thrives. You are welcomed and encouraged to bring your whole self to work. Dignity, respect and equality are non-negotiables. If you require accommodation during any part of the recruitment or selection process, please reach out.

Closing Date
 Position closes at 12:01am on the close date identified below.
01/30/2023

jobDescription:
Description
SECURE’s Business Intelligence team is seeking an Operations Intelligence Analyst, to help drive innovation and fact-based decision making across the organization. When you join our team, you’re joining an organization with big ideas and a commitment to doing what’s right. We work as one team and value solving the industry’s most challenging and innovative problems.
Who are you?
You believe data helps businesses solve real-world problems. You enjoy thinking big to find insights that nobody else sees and you can translate these insights to business value. You have:
Customer obsession and an entrepreneurial spiritA strong understanding of how to apply technology to achieve business outcomesA collaborative and stakeholder-focused approach to teamworkCuriosity and a willingness to seek out new information and explore innovative approachesA proactive attitude and a desire to take action to make things better
What will you do?
You will do more than just present data – you’ll be responsible for problem solving and brainstorming the best ways to design and develop unique solutions to solve our customers’ challenges. These solutions play a critical role in allowing Secure to maximize end to end value both internally and for the delivery of service to SECURE’s customers. You will:
 Collaborate with diverse teams to understand operational considerations/challenges Think big to provide insights and new ideas based on data analysis. Execute on ideas by bringing key stakeholders together Develop dashboards and other visualizations to help operational teams track key metrics and make data-driven decisions. Continuously improve data collection and analysis to ensure accurate and relevant data. Identify and implement new technologies and techniques for improving data-driven decision-making within the organization Learn from other industries to apply best in class practices to SECURE
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in a related field such as Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Business.2+ years of experience in a data analysis or operations intelligence role.Proficiency with data analysis and visualization tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, and PowerBIStrong problem-solving, communication, and analytical skillsExperience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud is a plus
We are looking for a team player who is passionate about using data to drive business outcomes and is eager to learn and grow with our organization. If you are a self-starter with a passion for innovation and improving operations, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
Why SECURE?
At SECURE, we focus on opportunities for growth and improvement; for our employees, our customers, our partners, and the communities we operate in. We are an energetic team, driven by the needs of our customers, and care about making a meaningful contribution. We strive to attract, retain, and motivate employees by offering a compensation package that competitively recognizes employee contributions and performance.
In addition to rewarding job opportunities, we offer an attractive employee package, including:
Competitive base salary and compensation programsComprehensive benefits package including:Employer paid benefits: health, dental & moreHealth Care Spending AccountEmployee Wellness ProgramEmployee savings plans and company matchingCareer progression/internal mobility opportunitiesCommunity investment activitiesCompany/team building events
Stay connected to us:
Visit us at secure-energy.com and connect with us on our social media channels for our latest job postings, news, community activities, and other updates.SECURE is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants are not assessed on the grounds of: race, age, disability, sexual discrimination, religion or belief.
companyDescription:
Headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, we focus on moving energy forward so our customers, communities and society can thrive. Building on our dedication to customers, we are delivering solutions and doing midstream differently through:

-Empowering our employees to deliver solution-oriented customer service

-Helping our customers reduce costs and maximize the netback for the water and oil we handle for our customers

-Strategically locating our network of midstream infrastructure across western Canada and the U.S.

We are working transparently with our customers to pioneer midstream solutions that help reduce costs and protect the environment today and tomorrow.

Our vision is to Do Midstream Differently.

jobDescription:
At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up - as individuals and as a team - to accomplish our strategy.

Business Intelligence Analyst

At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.

CWB is on a mission to become the best full-service bank for business owners of Canada.

We are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to fulfill the development, enhancements and support for all data warehouse, data marts, reporting, data visualizations and dashboards for the Canadian Western Bank Financial Group. This includes the documentation of all requirements and development details aligned to audit expectations.

As part of the Information Management team and in partnership with the business, you will utilize data from source systems to populate data assets and build attractive, intuitive and insightful information products.

If you are passionate about data analysis and find excitement in using your findings to drive business decisions, we want to hear from you!

What you will be responsible for
Assist business stakeholders in realizing their stated objectives through the use of data assets and information products that enable better and faster decisions and ensure completed solutions meet their specified requirements.Effectively communicate and build rapport with team members and business partners.Develop complex, mission critical reports, projects and applications.Deliver professional quality of data analysis and ETL processes to reduce the high consequence of error.Gather and formally document the object inventory, capturing details including data sources and data requirements to fulfill internal and external audit requirements.Build Extract, Transform, Load processes using SAS Data Integrator based on a logical model or design.Perform peer code reviews to ensure consistency to design, development and maintenance standards.Contribute to design and development standard methodologies and guidelines.Monitor and remediate all issues with the data warehouse/data marts and reports.Provide knowledge transfer to the other members of the development team.Perform and support daily tasks such as job scheduling, monitoring, troubleshooting and remediation.Support testing of solutions in all applicable environments.Support partners in the use of information products.Assist with training materials, and demonstrations.Ensure issues are identified, tracked, reported on and resolved in a timely manner.Participate in post-project implementation reviews or ‘lessons learned’, incorporating these lessons into appropriate process documentation, standards templates and checklists.Perform other duties as assigned by the Information Management leaders.
What You Will Bring To This Role
College diploma or university degree in Computer Science or related technology field.Experience in database and/or reporting environments incorporating Microsoft SQL Server technology.Strong query/data manipulation skills, especially utilizing Structured Query Language (SQL).Experience in data warehouse or data mart design and development.Experience with ETL processes/tools, SAS Data Integration studio considered a benefit.Working knowledge of TFS or equivalent project management, development management tools.Education in Advanced Mathematics and/or Statistics is an assetEducation or experience in Machine Learning and/or Artificial Intelligence is considered an assetExcellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills.Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.Ability to work with moderate supervision.Experience working on complex assignments requiring continuous periods of concentration, with periodic interruption.Strong organizational and analytical skills.Good interpersonal and communication (written & verbal) skills, including Technical writing ability.
Ignite your career. Apply with CWB today.

Why work with us?

Winners of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020 

& recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada by Great Places to Work

Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference. Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Flexible work arrangements. Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Compressed work weeks & more!

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities. Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work. Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Enhance. At CWB we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection. Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services. Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards. Yup! We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives.

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Targeted Diversity Language

Bring you. All of you. Feminist. First Nations band member. Gay rights activist. Sign language speaker. Labels don’t matter here, but your perspective does.

All applicants are welcome, and we expressly encourage applicants to apply who identify as women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities (including physical, mental, sensory, learning impairment, etc.), Indigenous peoples (including First Nations, Metis and Inuit), LGBTQ2S+ and/or racialized persons. We are specifically seeking diversity in this role, because at CWB we believe that inclusion has power, and we’re looking for some unique perspectives to add to this area of our business. We have a culture that thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration, respect, caring and camaraderie. If you have a voice to add to the conversation, we’d love you to apply.

As an equitable employer, CWB Financial Group is committed to providing a safe and inclusive environment where a diverse workforce thrives. You are welcomed and encouraged to bring your whole self to work. Dignity, respect and equality are non-negotiables. If you require accommodation during any part of the recruitment or selection process, please reach out.

Closing Date
 Position closes at 12:01am on the close date identified below.
01/30/2023

jobDescription:
ATCO Frontec is seeking a Data Analyst friendly professional who works well in a collaborative environment, loves programming and data science, enjoys problem-solving and can work independently and in a team. This is an excellent opportunity to become involved in a positive, challenging, and creative work environment.


RESPONSIBILITIES 
- Lead or contribute to the assessment, design, development and implementation of new technological applications for Frontec 
- Lead or contribute to data mapping, gathering, processing, and analysis 
- Lead or contribute to the digitization of new and existing business processes, including software selection, algorithm design, implementation, testing, and quality assurance 
- Explore, assess, recommend and implement improvements or enhancements to existing processes through innovative technology 
- Be a technical resource to projects, peers, and other functional departments throughout Frontec 
- Provide end-user training to stakeholders as needed 
- Update and maintain standardized resource documents and training materials 
- Administer permissions and ensure data and identity access management principles are adhered to for a given application 
- Presents digitized process to stakeholders in the company and gathers feedback for improvement


QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS: 
- Strong background in the technology field 
- Strong background in GIS and big data 
- Understanding and application of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) or Functional Programming; familiarity and competence with two or more programming languages (Python, JavaScript, Java, C, C++, R, Swift, etc.) 
- Working knowledge of Cloud Computing preferred; database querying, control, and manipulation 
- Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills; must possess excellent listening, written, and verbal skills 
- Understanding of APIs 
- Understanding of software development fundamentals and practices like code reviews and testing 
- Knowledge or exposure to Agile/Scrum methodology 
- Knowledge or desire to explore process automation, IIoT, GIS, AI, VR/AR


We would like to thank everyone for their application; however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted. 
Final candidates will be required to undergo a Security Clearance Check. 
Collection, use, and retention of personal information will be in accordance with ATCO Group privacy policies and practices. 
By submitting your resume and personal information to the ATCO Group of Companies, and/or participating in a personal interview, you acknowledge and consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal information by the ATCO Group of Companies to determine your suitability for employment opportunities within the ATCO Group of Companies.

jobDescription:

Location: Remote - Alberta

Required Skills and Experience:

A degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Commerce/Business, Economics, Business Administration or a similar information science discipline is required. Preference is given to individuals with or achieving professional designation such as PRM, FRM, CFA, etc.

jobDescription:
COMPANY:Founded over 175 years ago, Labatt is one of Canada’s founding businesses and its leading brewer. We are proud of our history and our heritage in Canada, and we remain committed to brewing great-tasting, high-quality beers that have satisfied beer drinkers for generations. Labatt has created exciting experiences with consumers through iconic brands like Budweiser, Bud Light, NÜTRL, Michelob Ultra, Corona, Stella Artois and many more. Through our broad portfolio, we are truly a national brewer, with over 3,600 employees, a portfolio of more than 60 quality beers and beyond, and 10 breweries from coast-to-coast, we are proud to serve Canada and the communities we call home.

Job ResponsibilitiesProviding reporting to senior management on sales performanceProvide regional and national insight on industry and company specific trendsResponsible for maintaining data integrity and managing data validation processes.Cascading achievable & objective targets that stretch the regional sales team and align to the National goalWork cross-functionally to improve Sales intelligence processes and ensure accuracy and stability of reporting

WHY LABATT: As one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Labatt is a place where our people can bring out the best in themselves through a collective purpose of creating A Future With More Cheers. We are always looking to serve up new ways to meet life’s moments, dream big to move our industry forward, and make a meaningful impact in our communities. We believe in brewing up a future that everyone can celebrate and share.

companyDescription:
Labatt is one of Canada’s founding businesses and its leading brewer. Our roots go back  170 years to a single small brewery founded by John Kinder Labatt in London, Ontario in 1847 – where our hometown brewery still stands. Today we are truly a national brewer with 3,400 employees across Canada, a portfolio of more than 60 quality beers, and nine breweries from coast to coast. 

Our breweries in Creston, Edmonton, London, Montreal, Halifax and St. John’s are proud to brew Canada’s most iconic beers, including Labatt Blue, Kokanee, Budweiser, Bud Light, Alexander Keith’s and Lucky. 

As an important part of Anheuser-Busch InBev, the world’s leading brewer, Labatt also distributes AB InBev’s global brands such as Stella Artois and Corona and international brands Beck’s, Leffe and Hoegaarden in Canada. AB InBev is first among brewers on Fortune Magazine’s World’s Most Admired Companies list in 2014, and is one of the globe’s top five consumers goods companies.

At Labatt, it’s not about what you studied, or where you worked, it’s about what you can do.  If you see yourself working for a company that allows you to excel at the pace of your talent, then a career at Labatt may be for you. 

Want to learn more? Visit us at www.labattjobs.com

jobDescription:
We are looking for a Data Specialist who will report to the Manager of Product Definition Business Processes, and who’ll be tasked with helping us define and sustain data of the product development teams. As part of your role, you’ll be significantly contributing to the organization's digital transformation. You’ll be be part of an amazing project team that will implement new processes, latest and greatest Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) tools and redefine the data models ALL-AT-ONCE!.

BECOME PART OF OUR TEAM

Here at BRP, we’re creating new ways to get people moving forward, where their experiences are measured by emotion rather than distance. All around the world, our products, achievements and aspirations are a reflection of our teams’ exceptional expertise. Want to bring your true self on this adventure?

You’ll Have The Opportunity To
Develop data definitions, information models, data standards, rules of governance and data management processes; think Product configurations, Bill of Materials, Process plans, CAD and even more data created during product development.Work closely with process owners to define requirements around data and translate that into technical functions with IT and partners; be the glue for Process-People-ToolCommunicate technical and complex concepts to everyone to enhance understanding and drive decisions; let’s democratize data togetherBe responsible for the design and rollout of a master data architecture that supports business processes in product development and management; leverage your drive, creativity and problem solving skills to get this major transformation a successful one
THIS ROLE IS A GOOD FIT IF YOU HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS AND QUALITIES: 
You try to understand how business and data are connected even outside your workYou have a Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, business administration, statistics, mathematics, computer engineering or another relevant fieldYou love to use your ability in problem solving and analysis skills to tie a technical element (e.g., data models) to the company’s operational elements (e.g., business process mapping) and propose solutionsYou act as a data translator; being able to reconcile what team members from different backgrounds are saying, bridge the gap between business and technicalYou have experience in product development and PLM? Tell us about it, that could be your differentiator!Our team is based in Quebec, but we are working with people from around the world, so you will need to master both French and English to exchange with all team members and partners.Do you have other qualifications? Tell us what is unique about you that is a great addition to the team.Does this sound like you? We look forward to receiving your application. 
AT BRP, WHEN WE TALK ABOUT BENEFITS, WE GO ALL IN.

Let’s start with a strong foundation — You want it, we have it:
Annual bonus: we work hard, and we know it. This yearly thank you is our way to fuel your dreams.Generous paid time away: winding down is as important as creating the future of recreational products. Pension plan: we want to make sure you’ll enjoy retirement; we’ve got you covered. Collective saving opportunities: being part of BRP allows you to tap into the strength of our saving programs. Industry leading healthcare: fully paid by BRP, this program is here for you, whatever happens, so you can focus on what matters.
What About Some Feel Good Extras
Flexible work schedule: balance is key to innovation, and we want to make sure you are at the top of your game with a schedule that will work for you. Summer schedule: time flies at BRP, so we hit pause to enjoy it.Holiday season shutdown: between Christmas and New Year’s, we close our facilities and refill on good times.Educational resources: you love what you do, and we get you resources to stay cutting-edge, so we all win together.Discount on BRP products: what we build is amazing, freeing, revolutionary, and you're first in line for the experience.
WELCOME TO BRP

We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce made up of close to 20,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey.

AN EXCEPTIONAL AREA! >
companyDescription:
We create innovative ways to move – on snow, on water, on asphalt or dirt – even in the air.

Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, BRP has been reimagining the way you access your world since 2003 and beyond. Building on a tradition of ingenuity and intense customer focus that go all the way back to 1937, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Austria and Australia. We have a total workforce of more than 14,500 driven, resourceful people.

Our portfolio of industry-leading and distinctive products comprises Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-Doo watercraft, Can-Am on- and off-road vehicles, Alumacraft, Manitou, Quintrex boats and Rotax marine propulsion systems as well as Rotax engines for karts and recreational aircraft. We support our product lines with a dedicated parts, accessories and clothing business, to fully enhance your riding experience.

Because it’s not about the destination. It’s about the journey. Yours.

Twitter: @BRPnews /// @BRPnouvelles

jobTitle: Senior Data Analyst, Partner Development – (Statistics/ML/BI) (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
jobDescription:
About Agoda
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
Get to know our team:
Partner Development is a team of creative entrepreneurs that develop solutions for Agoda’s accommodation partners and promote Agoda’s top and bottom line growth. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we roll out new product to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.
In this role you’ll get to
This role is designed to mainly growth opportunity identification among mid to long tail hotels, experiment execution and data tracking within Partner Development team for the global teams. You will get to work directly with the regional team to design and put in place global experimentation and initiatives to drive tangible impact in each market.
Key activities involved include but not limit to:
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to identify opportunities for business improvements and support your recommendationsOwn end-to-end project or roll out new experiments to validate in-market impact of an initiative within Partner DevelopmentBuild dashboards, identify new and track key metrics to closely monitor team’s performance and identify quick and long term opportunities for improvementsWork closely with cross-functional teams of analysts, regional team leads, product managers and business owners to drive changes based on opportunities identifiedSupport global Partner Development related initiatives, including experimentation infrastructure-building and methodology standardization
What You’ll Need To Succeed
Bachelor’s degree in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline4-8 years experience working in a business analysis, data analysis, reporting or business strategy roleExcellent problem-solving skills including the ability to analyze and resolve complex problems using dataTeam player with strong interpersonal, relationship-building, and stakeholder management skillsCoding skills for analytics and data manipulation (SQL, R, Python, Pandas, Scala)Data visualization tool experience such as with Tableau or your weapon of choiceAbility to work under pressure in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environmentExcellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English), with proven ability to convey complex messages clearly and with conviction

companyDescription:
Agoda is transforming travel for millions of customers across the globe. 

Headquartered in Asia, Agoda is one of the world’s largest online travel platforms. Founded in 2005 and now part of Booking Holdings (Nasdaq:BKNG), Agoda has a network of over 2,900,000 properties worldwide. Our web and mobile products provide a first-rate reservation service in 38 languages that uniquely combines local knowledge and local connections to provide the best deals for business and leisure travelers.

Agoda employs over 7,000 professionals from 90 nationalities in locations around the globe. In every department – from engineering to customer experience – we provide an environment rich with creativity, collaboration, and experimentation, and the tools to work faster and smarter.

At Agoda, we believe our people are our strength. We work hard and have fun, and we choose people who are dedicated to making things great.

For properties seeking partnership with Agoda, visit https://connect.agoda.com

jobTitle: Analyste Développeur.euse - Données campagnes numériques - Mandat
jobDescription:
Analyste Développeur.euse - Données campagnes numériquesContrat de 6 mois renouvelable Montréal
Astek recrute pour l’un de ses clients un.e Analyste Développeur.euse - Données campagnes numériques.En tant qu'ambassadeur de la donnée numérique vous serez responsable, grâce à vos capacités d'analyse, de soutenir le marketing en ligne. Vous contribuerez à l'élaboration de la feuille de route analytique; superviserez la mise en place des plans de mesure; produirez des rapports et analyserez les performances des campagnes numériques.

Vous serez connu pour :
• Être l’expert de la donnée des campagnes numériques afin de répondre rapidement aux besoins d’information et d’analyse.• Développer des processus d’intégration (ELT) des données de campagne en provenance des plateformes sociales (Facebook & Instagram, Youtube, Twitter, etc.) et plateformes média (Campaign Manager, Google Ads, Facebook Ads, etc.) dans l’environnement Google Cloud Platform (GCP).• Modéliser les données de campagne numérique à des fins d’analyse de performance et créer des jeux de données pouvant être utilisés par les principales parties prenantes.• Développer et entretenir des relations avec les principales parties prenantes (Social, Marketing digital, agences externes, etc.) afin de bien comprendre les données pouvant répondre à leurs besoins d’affaires.• Consolider les données dans des tableaux de bord et créer des rapports hebdomadaires, mensuels, trimestriels et ad hoc.• Travailler conjointement avec les analystes des autres domaines de données afin d’identifier lesopportunités de création de valeur à l’aide de la donnée de campagnes numériques.• Partager vos connaissances et vos idées sur les nouvelles technologies et plateformes et émergentes.

Nous souhaitons vous rencontrer si vous avez :
• Baccalauréat en marketing et/ou finance, mathématique, économie ou informatique.• Expérience requise de 4 à 5 ans dans un poste similaire.• Expérience avec la modélisation de la donnée des médias sociaux (Facebook & Instagram, Youtube, Twitter, etc.)• Expérience avec la modélisation de la donnée des plateformes média (Campaign Manager, Google Ads, Facebook Ads, etc.)• Expérience en intégration de données sur Google Cloud Platform (GCP)• Connaissance en bases de données, BigQuery et requêtes SQL• Expérience avec des outils de visualisation, Power BI (un atout).• Mentalité axée sur les méthodologies quantitatives et volonté de travailler dans un environnement complexe de données.• Excellentes aptitudes en communication et interpersonnelles.• Maîtrise du français et de l'anglais.
companyDescription:
The ASTEK Group is a 30 year-old global Information Technology (IT) consulting and engineering firm with more than 4,500 employees in over 15 countries.

Since 1988, our women and men have successfully led our clients' development strategies. Around common values, we have earned their trust and respond to their corporate challenges by placing their needs at the center of our actions and priorities.

ASTEK Canada specializes in the recruitment and staffing of employees and contract resources in information technology. Our job is to locate, recruit and assign IT professionals. Our strength lies in our team of experienced and highly qualified IT recruiters and consulting professionals.

Since its inception, ASTEK Canada has filled several hundred contract and permanent IT positions.

Our reputation as a partner of choice in business and IT talent management has been based on the quality of our candidates, our persistence in identifying and securing the right profiles, as well as our integrity and thoroughness in our business relationships!

We promote conviviality and simplicity!

Looking forward to working together!

jobDescription:
Individual must have a passion for data to lead the Data & Analytics team with support from the VP, Data & Analytics for Nissan United Canada. This is an involved role that permeates all aspects of Marketing & Communication decision making, must be able to balance the strategic vision of business with the tactical capabilities of a hands-on practitioner. Top Priorities:• Understand the role of data in driving decisions in media & marketing.• Ability to translate real world asks into mathematical models.• Ability to adapt methodology and output to changing client requirements.• Ensure data and insights are consistently used to inform planning, strategy and creative development• Coordinate with media, creative and strategy teams and understand how analytics delivers value• Implement new data and tech processes that align with global requirements• Support the measurement and optimization of audiences and segments across all channels Primary Responsibilities:• Provide recommendations on budget planning using Econometric/Market Mix/Statistical Modelling; provide sales forecasts, scenario planning• Implement and oversee audience building, analytics, attribution, budgeting & optimization via OMNI (leveraging 1P, 2P, 3P data sources)• Omni is Omnicom’s people-based precision marketing and insights platform, designed to identify and define personalized consumer experiences at scale• Lead & implement global data initiatives including (but not limited to) taxonomy, DMP setup, management, training and usage• Develop integrated insight reporting framework to be developed cross-agency for Nissan campaigns• Drive continuous improvement of data sources, vendors and platforms to expand profiling capabilities• Seek to automate reports and dashboards to drive efficiencies, accuracy and speed of data• Oversee monthly/quarterly/annual reporting, analysis and insight generation to optimize usage of data and support business and client needs• Share findings and learnings to stakeholders, vendors and partners as needed Ideal Candidate would have:• 3+ years of data and analytics experience• Ability to build long-term client relationships with client directors and department leads• Skilled at strong, persuasive communications, both 1:1 and in bigger forums• Experience with Google Marketing Products (GA360/4, DV360, SA360, GOOGLE ADS, CM)• Strong capabilities in econometrics, programming, MMM, MTA, algorithm and machine learning models (Python, R, SQL)• Understand financial operations for a client’s business, including resourcing, revenue and profitability Technical SkillsetBackend : SQLProgramming : Python (Preferred) / R / GoCloud Skills : Google Cloud Platform/AWSFront-End/Visualization : Tableau / PowerBI / Datorama / Data Studio

companyDescription:
We are a full-service advertising and creative agency offering brands integrated communications, brand strategy, in-house production, digital expertise, and branding & design services. Located in the heart of North America’s fourth-largest city, Juniper Park\TBWA is a world-class agency that just happens to be headquartered in Toronto.

Our true competitive advantage is our Disruption® methodology. We identify the cultural or market conventions to overturn. We scrutinize the future to determine what could lift the brand higher. And we define a Disruption platform that inspires the way the brand behaves and communicates. Over its 25+ year history as part of the TBWA collective, our agency has continued to evolve the Disruption® methodology to fit the ever-changing needs of our clients. We find new ways to break conventions, innovate in the marketplace, connect with consumers at the speed of culture and deliver unprecedented brand and business results on behalf of our clients.

Want to join our growing team? Email us at iwantajob@jptbwa.com.

jobDescription:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

Profile Description 

Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

The opportunity

We are looking for a Data analyst, Controls and Compliance, Reporting and Analysis to deliver on reporting and analysis, development and automation of dashboards through Power BI, and to build our SharePoint site.

The Data Analyst will deliver on reporting and analysis, development and automation of dashboards through Power BI, and will build our SharePoint site.

Responsibilities
Collecting, organizing, analyzing and interpreting data to extrapolate patterns that will provide direction that can be used to take back to the business using visualization toolsCurate data from various systems sourcesPreparing the data set for the analysis by querying the systems or using reporting resources availableEvaluate the data quality and completeness of the data availableDevelop user-friendly dashboards using Power BI to support the business in data-driven decision making and operationsProficient with the use of Microsoft SharePoint collaborative platformHelp foster an environment within the organization that promotes the use of data and analytics as a tool to support business decisionsOther Duties as assigned
What motivates you?
You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit.You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile approach and enable business outcomes.You thrive in teams and enjoy getting things done together.You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters.You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up.You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone.
What We Are Looking For
You will have analytical skills, ability to derive value from dataYou will be a self-proclaimed data analyst using Power BI and Excel. It would be nice to have SQL and Python knowledgeYou will be confident working and maintaining SharePoint sitesIT Audit and Technology risk experience is preferred but not required
What can we offer you?
A competitive salary and benefits packages.A growth trajectory that extends upward and outward, encouraging you to follow your passions and learn new skills.A focus on growing your career path with us.Flexible work policies and strong work-life balance.Professional development and leadership opportunities.
Our commitment to you
Values-first culture We lead with our Values every day and bring them to life together.Boundless opportunity We create opportunities to learn and grow at every stage of your career.Continuous innovation We invite you to help redefine the future of financial services.Delivering the promise of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion We foster an inclusive workplace where everyone thrives.Championing Corporate Citizenship We build a business that benefits all stakeholders and has a positive social and environmental impact.
Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

About John Hancock And Manulife

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.
companyDescription:
Manulife is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. jobDescription:
TALTEK cherche à combler le poste suivant pour l’un de ses clients :
Analyste d’affaire BI
 À PROPOS DU CLIENTOrganisation canadienne, 325 sites, 1 200 employésEnvironnement au rythme rapideOrganisation en croissanceEnvironnement positif
RÉSUMÉ DU POSTEL’analyste d’affaires BI a le mandat d’effectuer les analyses BI dans les domaines d’affaires et technologiques. Il gère le processus complet des demandes clients allant de la définition des besoins jusqu'à l’implantation du changement en passant par l’analyse fonctionnelle et les tests. Il est aussi responsable de la feuille de route BI ainsi que les analyses proactives touchant le BI.
RESPONSABILITÉSMaintenir la relation avec les membres de l’équipe d’affaires et comprendre les besoins d’affaires.Diriger les analyses fonctionnellesConseiller et assister les clients et les utilisateurs dans une perspective d’amélioration et d’innovation.Identifier et définir les besoins d’affaires dans le respect des stratégies d'affaires et TI.Participer à la planification et la priorisation des activités d’amélioration et de projets, tout en maintenant un œil critique par rapport aux bénéfices escomptés.Analyser, modéliser et documenter les processus d’affaires, les solutions, les données et les procédures.Proposer des options de solutions et supporter leur mise en place en assurant le contrôle de la qualité.Assurer une saine gestion de l’écosystème.Suivre l’évolution des solutions implantées et offrir du support au besoin.Coordonner les activités des équipes opérationnelles TI pour la résolution de problèmes et apporter le support aux équipes de projets.Élaborer des indicateurs de performance pour mesurer la performance des solutions.Réaliser une vigie afin de demeurer à l’affût des tendances et des meilleures pratiques ayant cours dans son champ d'expertise
EXIGENCESBaccalauréat en Technologies de l’information ou expériences pertinentes équivalentes5 - 10 années d’expériences pertinentes.3 - 6 années d’expérience de travail en analyse d’affairesExpérience avec le domaine des assurances; un atoutExpérience dans des projets de développement de solution BIIntérêt pour l’infonuagique et les technologies modernes en BI (Snowflake, Azure Data Factory, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)Connaissances approche DevOps; un atoutÀ l’aise avec les concepts ETL, ELT, lac de données, modélisation de données, etc.Organisé et capable de réagir aux défis d'un environnement en évolution rapideFaire preuve d’initiative et d’innovation.Fortes aptitudes pour le travail d’équipe.Qualités de leader reconnues.Habiletés pour les relations interpersonnelles, la communication et la pédagogie.Organisation méthodique du travail et gestion du temps.Bilingue : Bonne maitrise du français/anglais (à l’oral et à l’écrit). Ce rôle exige un travail fréquent avec des équipes situées à l’extérieur du Québec et la capacité de communiquer avec elles tant oralement que par écrit.Mode hybride (1 jour par semaine au bureau)Grand Montréal
À PROPOS DE TALTEKTALTEK est une société de placement et de conseil en technologie de l’information. Chez TALTEK, nous nous engageons à offrir le meilleur niveau de service à nos clients et candidats. Notre approche est humaine et nos valeurs sont : la transparence, l’intégrité et le respect.
